If I don't want my child to be thrown forward with his or her car seat, I attach the seat to the car seat using the Isofix system or the seat belt, as appropriate.

questions: I drive at 50 km/h :

When I alert the emergency services, I always wait for their agreement before hanging up to make sure that the information has been properly transmitted.

questions: I'm on the freeway. I drive at the right speed in the rain:
explanation: How fast should I drive when it's raining?         Freeways have the highest speed limit (130 km/h). In rainy weather, this speed is reduced to 110 km/h to reduce the risk of losing grip. So I have to slow down.

questions: Grab an object from the glove compartment:

questions: A well-adjusted headrest prevents whiplash:

However, this equipment should not prevent me from checking my mirrors, or turning around to see what's going on behind me, to make sure that a pedestrian isn't about to pass behind me, for example.

questions: I can go across the street:

I can take a maximum of one course per year.

questions: I move slowly:

I slow down and double my vigilance, keeping a sharp right behind the white vehicle. There's no point in honking.

questions: If I don't regularly make sure I have enough engine oil :
choices: A I improve the braking of my vehicle

explanation: Why check the oil level?         Oil is essential to limit wear on the engine's mechanical parts. If the oil level is too low, the engine will "break". That's why I have to check regularly that the oil level in the dipstick is correct.           It must be between the two "min" and "max" marks. If it's low, I add the right oil for my vehicle's engine. I should always carry out these checks and readjustments when the engine is cold and on level ground.

questions: The essential index is in :

In a zone where there are so many clues to watch out for, the first thing to do is to slow down to give yourself more time to analyze the clues as best you can. Its position doesn't allow me to see if there are any pedestrians in front of it, nor if it intends to start up again in a few seconds. I remain vigilant and keep to the left.

questions: The road markings help me to assess the safety space in front of me:

The distances in front and behind me are sufficient.

questions: On the right, the road markings indicate :

questions: I'm overtaking now:

explanation: When is it wise to overtake?  I'm behind a pedestrian running along the edge of the road. We're about to enter a bend. It would be very dangerous to overtake here without leaving the necessary 1.50 m lateral space. If a motorist comes up ahead, I won't have time to turn around without putting the pedestrian at risk.  So I slow down and go at a walking pace. I'll pass him after the bend when I can.

questions: I'm driving at 80km/h. The car behind me is flashing its headlights at me:
explanation: How do we deal with this behavior?  The key word is "safety"! When I'm driving, I have to obey the signs and not be reckless. I have to remain calm in the face of agitated road users who are trying to put pressure on me.  In this situation, I'm driving at 80 km/h and can maintain my speed, as it corresponds to the authorized speed limit. I don't go looking for an accident and I don't accelerate despite the pressure.

questions: If I lose 1 point on my driver's license during an offence, I could get it back at the end :
explanation: Is it possible to recover points automatically? When I lose a point on my license, I can get it back automatically after 6 months if I don't commit another offence. However, if I do commit another offence, I will have to wait two or three years after the offence before I can get my points back.

questions: Suspension:
choices: B keeps tires in contact with the ground
C ensures vehicle stability on the ground
explanation: What is the role of suspension?  Commonly referred to as a "shock absorber", the suspension is the mechanical element that connects the wheels to the vehicle. It maintains contact between the tires and the ground (regardless of ground conditions), and plays a particularly important role in cornering and braking, ensuring good roadholding.     In this way, it enhances passenger comfort, preventing them from being jolted by the slightest bump in the road.

questions: Under these conditions, I remove the snow:

explanation: What are the risks of snow before setting off? It obscures visibility through windshields, side windows and light clusters.    To see, I clear all the windows. And to be better seen by other road users, I clear the headlights. There's no need to remove snow from the hood. It will melt thanks to the heat emitted by the engine.

questions: I supplement the GPS sound guidance with brief visual readings of the screen:

questions: The perception of cues in the visual field is improved:
explanation: What is the visual field? It's the portion of space seen by the eyes staring straight ahead. When the eyes are fixed on the road, they are able to detect other cues in a limited area, such as road signs and other road users.  At standstill, this visual field is around 180 degrees. But the greater the speed, the narrower the field of vision. This is known as the "tunnel effect". At 35 km/h, I can see a lot more clues than at 80 km/h".

questions: in this situation
explanation: What are the risks? Pedestrians may change direction at the last moment.  I slow down and pass them cautiously, maintaining a lateral safety distance of at least 1 m, since I'm in a built-up area. There's no imminent danger, so I don't need to use my horn.

questions: To adopt "eco-driving", it is preferable :
choices: B change gear quickly at the start and then maintain a steady speed
explanation: What is eco-driving?  It means driving in a way that respects the environment and the people around me.    To do this, I anticipate to avoid unnecessary acceleration and braking, I keep safe distances, I shift gears quickly and I drive slightly below the speed limit.

questions: Involved in a minor material accident, I must :

explanation: What to do in the event of a material accident? It's important to always take responsibility for your actions. In the event of a material accident, I must stop and inform those involved of my identity.  I protect the scene of the accident, then, armed with my driver's license, insurance certificate and vehicle registration document, I fill in the accident report form with the people involved.

questions: In traffic, a red warning light :

If it's an orange light, I can continue for a few more kilometers.

So it's always best to get children into or out of the car on the kerbside.

questions: A young driver is able to read all the driving cues at the same time:

The vehicle in front brakes, as indicated by its stop lights (red lights). And finally, a vehicle comes up in front.  It's hard for a young driver to pick up on all these clues and know how to behave! That's why young drivers have reduced maximum speeds on freeways. The more I drive, the more easily I'll be able to perceive and analyze dangers.

questions: This pedestrian has the right to cross here:

questions: Speed evaluation is impaired when driving at night:

The landmarks are not the same, affecting my ability to assess distances and speeds.  What's more, I can be dazzled by vehicles coming in front or behind me. It takes about 5 seconds for my vision to return to normal, which makes it all the more difficult to judge distance and speed.

questions: The vehicle's clean air filter :

questions: A well-adjusted headrest prevents whiplash:

questions: The restriction code "01" does not appear on my license. I can drive with my glasses :

questions: To maintain a constant speed, I use :

questions: E-Call :

questions: The risk of falling asleep is greater between :

questions: I buy a car based on :

questions: On a dry road, the stopping distance at 110 km/h is approximately :

explanation: What are the rules for overtaking on freeways?  Like everywhere else, I overtake on the left.    I only use the left-hand lane to overtake.  And I don't drive below 80 km/h in that lane.

questions: I drive a vehicle with an automatic gearbox. Once parked, I activate :
- the position
- parking brake
explanation: On a vehicle with an automatic gearbox, what is the purpose of the different positions? Position P stands for Stop, R for Reverse, N for Neutral and D for Forward.  Once parked, before leaving my vehicle, I activate position P and engage the parking brake (also known as the handbrake). Position N, corresponding to neutral, can be used for a short stop, at a red light for example.

questions: I am comfortable in the driver's seat when :
choices: A my left leg is straight, resting on the clutch pedal
B my knees touch the steering wheel
C my arms are slightly bent
D I have good visibility when my settings are done
explanation: What's important about the driving position?  Reach the controls easily and see everything going on around the vehicle.    My arms, like my legs, need to be slightly bent. Poor posture accelerates fatigue.

questions: The child safety device is selected according to :
choices: D the type of vehicle used
explanation: Why do children need to be seated in an appropriate seat?  An incorrectly positioned seatbelt may not restrain the child properly, and may even cause further injury in the event of sudden braking.    Up to the age of 15 months, I carry my baby with his back to the road. After that, I use a seat adapted to his morphology.

questions: Rev counter :

explanation: What is a revolution counter? It's a measuring instrument that indicates the engine's rotation frequency.  This means you know when to change gear. It's a great tool for eco-driving. All you have to do is shift up a gear without revving up too much.

questions: At 70 km/h :

explanation: How to calculate distances quickly?  Multiply the speed ten by 3 to find the distance covered in 1 second, and by itself for the stopping distance.    So at 70 kph, I travel in 1 second (7x3) about 21 m and to stop (7x7) about 49 m.

questions: Le "Stop and start" :

explanation: Stop and start? What is it?  It's a device that automatically stops and restarts a vehicle's engine.    It helps reduce air and noise pollution, and saves up to 10% on fuel!

For example, on the freeway, at maximum speed, I have to leave a gap of 2 lines between me and the vehicle in front, to respect the 2 seconds of safety. This is the case here.

explanation: How are speed signs placed on expressways? Since there are several lanes, these signs are placed on the right and left, so that all users can see them.  The sign indicates that the 80 km/h speed limit applies only to vehicles over 3.5 tonnes.

questions: I just got my driver's license, I have :
explanation: How many points does my license have to start with?  All first-time drivers have 6 points for the first year.    Depending on the training taken, the license recovers 2 or 3 points per year. The maximum is 12 points.

questions: Irregular maintenance increases :
explanation: What is regular maintenance?  It means carrying out a monthly check on the condition of tires, fuel levels and so on. It also means having your car serviced by a professional so that he can check and carry out any necessary work.    Without it, I increase the risk of breakdowns and traffic accidents.

questions: I set my GPS :
explanation: What is a GPS?  This device allows me to program my route from point A to point B. To set it up, I look at and manipulate the screen. So I can't pay attention while driving.    I set my GPS before setting off, so I'm not distracted while driving.

questions: Alone at night, in unlit built-up areas, I use the lights :
explanation: Which lights to use? Position lights alone are not very powerful. Low-beam headlamps are a little more powerful and don't interfere with other road users. High beams are very powerful. They enable me to see ahead. But they are dazzling. Finally, the rear fog lights are very powerful and very dazzling. I use them ONLY when it's foggy or snowing.  On unlit roads, inside or outside built-up areas, I have to make sure I can see as far as possible. To do this, I use the most powerful lights, i.e. high beam. If someone is ahead of me, I use low beams to avoid dazzling them.

explanation: What is the purpose of directional signs?  To indicate a service or driving behavior.    Services are indicated by square white signs with a blue border. Driving instructions are shown on square signs with a blue background.

questions: The road markings help me assess the safety area:

explanation: How to evaluate the safety interval? There are three ways to check whether the safety interval is sufficient. I can use the road markings, multiply the speed by 6 or take a reference point.  I can't even see the headlights of the vehicle behind me in their entirety. It's much too close. It's less than 2 seconds away.

questions: This windsock indicates :
- wind direction
- wind intensity
explanation: What's a windsock for? To know the wind's intensity and direction.    The windsock is almost horizontal. This tells me that the wind is strong. It points to the right. The wind rushes in from the left and exits the windsock on the right.

questions: Fuel consumption depends on :
explanation: When does the engine consume more?  When it has to work harder!    When you press the gas pedal, you're asking the engine to make an effort. The heavier the vehicle, the greater the effort required to move it forward.

questions: This sign at tunnel entrances indicates the minimum safety distance to be maintained:
explanation: What does this sign at the entrance to a tunnel indicate?  The minimum safety distance to be maintained between two vehicles at a standstill and in traffic.    Maintaining a sufficient safety distance in a tunnel reduces the risk of accidents and of fire spreading. It also enables emergency services to circulate between users.

questions: Tire noise varies according to model:
explanation: What is tire rolling noise? When tires are rolling, they produce vibrations that create noise to a greater or lesser extent, depending on the vehicle's speed, the road surface and the tire model itself.  This noise can affect the comfort of drivers, passengers and local residents. The tire energy label introduced in 2012 can help me choose quieter tires."

questions: The stopping distance is equal to the distance covered during the braking time:
explanation: What is stopping distance?  It's the distance covered between the moment I detect the obstacle and the moment my vehicle stops.    Stopping distance therefore includes the distance covered during reaction time and braking distance.

questions: An unrestrained passenger in the rear is a danger :
- to their own safety
- for other occupants
explanation: What happens in the event of an accident?  Depending on speed, passengers can be thrown forward very violently.     This can result in serious injuries to unrestrained rear-seat passengers, as well as to front-seat passengers, on whom they are thrown.

questions: The crosswalk is :
explanation: What indicates the nature of the road markings? Its color!  White markings are permanent. Yellow markings are temporary, with the exception of parking and stop markings (bus stops, deliveries, etc.).

questions: I top up the engine oil level in the container:
explanation: What is engine oil used for? To limit wear and tear on the engine's mechanical parts. Without it, the engine will break down.  Container A is the dipstick. This is where I check my oil level. If the level is below the "mini" mark, I add engine oil to container B.  I consult the vehicle's owner's manual to add the right oil.

questions: Polyconsumption:
- multiplies the risk of accidents
explanation: What is poly-drug use? It's the simultaneous use of drugs, alcohol or medication. Each of these substances increases the risk of accident.  Road accident statistics show that poly-drug use multiplies the risk of accident by 29.

questions: For safe riding:
explanation: Can GPS sound be dangerous?  The fact that the GPS indicates directions verbally is practical. It means I don't have to keep looking at the screen and not see what's going on around me.    I use the sound indications and supplement the information with brief visual checks.

questions: I turn left.

explanation: What is the priority rule in this case?  The user who crosses the lane of other users must wait until the lane is clear.    By turning left, I'll be cutting in front of oncoming traffic: I'll give way to them.

explanation: Do these markings on the tire have any special significance?  These markings on the tire tread are wear indicators. I need to check them regularly to make sure my tires are in good condition. When the rubber on my tire reaches the top of the markings, my tires need to be changed.  Here I can drive with this level of wear.

questions: A good seat at the wheel allows :

- eliminate blind spots
explanation: Why is it important to be properly seated in the driver's seat?  To be able to operate controls quickly and take in information easily.    Blind spots are the areas not covered by the rearview mirrors. Nothing can eliminate them!

questions: I increase the safety distance:
explanation: What is the purpose of safety distance?  It helps avoid a collision when braking or slowing down suddenly.    It must be at least two seconds. But I'll increase it if I have less grip on the road, if I'm tired, or if the road signs require it.

questions: As soon as the streetcar has passed, I'll cross the intersection:
explanation: What's going on here? I'm stopped at a red light. A streetcar is passing. Even though there's no barrier, I have to wait for the light to turn green before I can pass.  As at any other intersection, I must respect the traffic signs, while taking care to ensure the safety of other road users and myself.

explanation: What should I do in this situation?  In front of me, a car is entering the carriageway and is already in my lane.  I stop to give him room to complete his maneuver. Even though he doesn't have priority, I'm showing him courtesy. What's more, with no one behind me, there's no risk.  I don't honk because there's no imminent danger.

questions: Blue spaces are reserved for :

explanation: Why is the site blue?  This highlights the reserved nature of the site.    This space is reserved for the disabled. It allows people with reduced mobility to move around without hindrance, open doors wide, etc.

questions: Turning on the lights:
explanation: What should I do?  To reduce the risk of accident, I slow down and make myself visible.    In addition to low-beam headlights, I can use front fog lights. They give you a better view of the edge of the road and make you even more visible from ahead. Rear fog lights enable following traffic to detect me early enough.

questions: I am authorized to drive a manual car if I hold :

- B license
explanation: What can I drive with an automatic clutch license (ACL)?  Only vehicles with automatic gearboxes.    The B license, on the other hand, allows you to drive vehicles with either automatic or manual gearboxes.

questions: I've just activated :

- The airbag passager
explanation: What does this pictogram indicate? Located on the front passenger side of the vehicle, this control activates or deactivates the corresponding airbag.  I must always deactivate the airbag when I'm transporting my baby in a rear-facing seat, as he or she could be irreversibly injured if the airbag is triggered. In all other cases, the airbag must be activated to protect my front passenger in the event of an accident.

questions: Instructions for changing a wheel are given in the operating instructions:
explanation: Is it possible to find this kind of information in the vehicle owner's manual?  Of course! My vehicle's manual contains various sections. In addition to a description of controls, possible options and possible breakdowns, I can find instructions on how to change a wheel.    However, it's best to be familiar with these before you're faced with a fait accompli. Having a clear understanding of the technique can save precious time in the event of a puncture.

questions: My passenger can get off immediately:

If my passenger opens the door, he could endanger himself and the moped driver.    I'll stop as soon as possible to allow my passenger to get off safely.

It allows me to choose the right gear, and prevents me from under- or over-speeding. The economical driving range is between 1,000 and 2,500 rpm (for a diesel vehicle).

questions: Following an offence detected by an automatic radar, points are withdrawn:
choices: B Following receipt of the letter from the prefecture
explanation: When are points deducted following a radar violation? The reality of an infringement resulting in a points deduction is established following receipt of a reference letter 48 (or 48N if I'm on probationary licence) informing me of the loss of points.  The letter indicates the date of the offence and the date on which the points were recorded. The remaining points balance is also indicated. This procedure can sometimes take several months.
